meanings.definition: To have placed a bet that is larger than what is considered appropriate or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: He overbetted on the horse race, risking too much money.
meanings.sent2: She always overbetted when playing poker with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overbetted all his acorns on a single game of chance.
meanings.sent4: The student overbetted his time studying for the easy quiz.
meanings.sent5: The chef overbetted on the amount of salt in the soup, making it too salty to eat.

meanings.definition: Past tense of overbet: to have placed a bet that is larger than what is considered appropriate or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: They overbetted on the basketball game last night and lost all their money.
meanings.sent2: After he overbetted at the casino, he regretted his impulsive decision.
meanings.sent3: The magician overbetted his luck and ended up with a rabbit in his hat.
meanings.sent4: The explorer overbetted on finding treasure in the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent5: The musician overbetted on his performance, but the audience loved it.
